content: Investments Bonds Securities Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Apr 2019What do you think of Frasers Property Treasury Bond (FPLSP 3.95 PERP)? Good to go and buy now? Thanks?1 answerAnswerBump0

Billy Ko, President - Investment Club at Singapore Institute Of TechnologyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 29 Apr 2019FPLSP 3.95 PERP is a corporate bond, meaning you need to purchase $250k minimum worth of this bond. https://secure.fundsupermart.com/fsm/bonds/factsheet/AP1551658/FPLSP-3-950-Perpetual-Corp-SGDAt this moment, this bond is trading below issue price, which equates to a higher Yield to Maturity (YTM). In a rising interest rates environment, bond prices might suffer further, do your due d and make sure that cash flows are able to sustain the payouts (don't let it be a repeat of Hyflux where cash was diminishing) Make sure they aren't using debt to repay debt also0 comments0
